newsitem.title: CHINA: China's Nov industrial output up 13.4 pct y/y.
newsitem.headline: China's Nov industrial output up 13.4 pct y/y.

text.p: China's industrial output rose 13.4 percent year on year in November, the State Statistical Bureau said on Monday.
Total output was 173.7 billion yuan ($20.9 billion).
In October, industrial output rose 13.3 percent from a year-earlier period.
The State Statistical Bureau gave no figures for the January to November period.
It said that in November alone state-owned industry showed a rise in output of 7.3 percent while collectively-owned industry posted a growth of 17.7 percent and the private sector rose 12 percent.
Light industry showed a rise of 15 percent in output while heavy industry was up 12.1 percent.
The State Statistical Bureau said the ratio of sales to production was 96.75 percent in November, up 0.93 percentage point from the same month a year ago.
Primary energy production rose 5.5 percent during the month with coal output rising 5.2 percent and crude oil climbing six percent. Electric power generation was up 5.7 percent.
Production of steel products and other key non-ferrous metals products showed increases ranging from 5.2 percent to 10.1 percent. Details were not available.
Output of telecommunications equipment showed a rapid rise during the month with digital switching equipment up as much as 29.5 percent.
